title: Smart motorways controversy escalates after boy is killed in M6 crash
text:
The smart motorway safety crisis deepened last night after a coroner demanded Highways England explain what can be done to spot stranded motorists trapped with no safe refuge.

In a major intervention, Emma Brown, the West Midlands area coroner, is to use her legal powers to warn lives are at risk after finding Dev Naran, aged eight, was killed after the car he was in stopped on a hard shoulder temporarily opened to traffic.

His grandfather had pulled over with hazard lights on before a lorry travelling at 56mph hit it in May last year on the M6.
